channel.title: Gateway Unable to Get Internet Connectivity from other VBOX?
channel.description:
Hi,
I have followed all the instructions provided on the site and implemented best practices as suggested.
I purchased a seperate USB wifi modem and have three VBOX running:
1. Ubuntu - Has USB WIFI attached to VM and directly connected to internet 2. Gateway 3. Workstation
I need the Gateway to use the internet from the Ubuntu VBOX. I want to keep the host totally compartmentalized (so I don't want to install the USB wifi on the host and then share it with the VBOX). Must stay separate.
I am pulling my hair out trying to get this to work. I can find so little information on VBOX forums about getting this network sync going from Gateway to UBU Guess VBOX VMs. Please patrick .., or anyone help?

item.title: Gateway Unable to Get Internet Connectivity from other VBOX?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Possible in theory as per https://www.whonix.org/wiki/About#Based_on_Debian. You would have to configure Whonix-Gateway eth0 as internal network in VirtualBox network settings. (Name it “internet” or so. Just don’t name it “Whonix”.) And edit /etc/network/interfaces accordingly (dhcp or static network, depending on the VM you are connecting to.) But this is unsupported. (https://www.whonix.org/wiki/FAQ#What_do_you_mean_by_unsupported.3F)
